<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

`hypre+cuda` build failing on LLNL Sierra-class platforms (e.g., RZAnsel).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

To reproduce this issue, I did the following on the RZAnsel system:

1\. Retrieve the spack source:
```console
$ git clone git@github.com:spack/spack.git
```

2\. Create the following config files (attached) within Spack's site configuration scope location, `$(prefix)/etc/spack`: 
 - compilers.yaml
 - packages.yaml
 - spack.yaml

3\.  Amend the hypre recipe file (patch attached). This is necessary to A) Make sure that a CUDA installation is actually available before proceeding with a `+cuda` build, and B) To provide a variant for Unified Memory support.

4\. Attempt to build:
```console
$ cd spack
$ source ./share/spack/setup-env.sh
$ spack env activate -d ./etc/spack
$ spack concretize -f
$ spack install -v
```

Dependencies install fine, but the `hypre` build fails at the end with:
```console
>> 877    /usr/tce/packages/xl/xl-2021.03.11-cuda-11.2.0/xlC/16.1.1/bin/.orig/xlc++_r: warning: 1501-228 input file "-I/usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/../targets/ppc64le-linux/include" not found
>> 878    /usr/tce/packages/xl/xl-2021.03.11-cuda-11.2.0/xlC/16.1.1/bin/.orig/xlc++_r: warning: 1501-228 input file "/usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/crt/link.stub" not found
     879    make[1]: *** [Makefile:101: libHYPRE.so] Error 252
     880    make[1]: Leaving directory '/tmp/quellyn/spack-stage/spack-stage-hypre-develop-i57trtg5
            2xpru34ixyliuebi3metda3x/spack-src/src/lib'
     881    make: *** [Makefile:86: all] Error 1
```

Confusingly, the missing files referenced are in fact present on the system:
```console
$ ls -ld /usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/../targets/ppc64le-linux/include/
drwxr-xr-x 10 root root 8192 Mar 30 13:44 /usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/../targets/ppc64le-linux/include/

$ ls -la /usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/crt/link.stub
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 6260 Feb 15 10:59 /usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-11.2.0/nvidia/bin/crt/link.stub
```
It's especially interesting to note that the `hypre` build does *not* fail on a similar architecture, the LANL Darwin cluster's Power9 nodes. There are toolchain differences between RZAnsel and Darwin:

Darwin Power9 (build succeeds):
- IBM XL 16.1.1.7 and Spectrum MPI 10.3.0.1
- GCC 8.3.0
- CUDA 11.0

RZAnsel (build fails):
- IBM XL 16.1.1.10 and Spectrum MPI 10.3.1.03rtm0
- GCC 8.3.1
- CUDA 11.2.20


### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2238-5d88f439f3
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-power9le
* **Concretizer:** original
```
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->
[hypre-fail.rzansel.tar.gz](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6328394/hypre-fail.rzansel.tar.gz)


### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6328409/spack-build-env.txt)
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6328410/spack-build-out.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
```console
$ spack maintainers hypre
balay  osborn9  ulrikeyang
```
@balay and @osborn9 are current maintainers (@ulrikeyang appears to be gone). 

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: hypre
